column4: my Sansa is not automatically mounting; how can I mount it manually?
what kind of sansa?
were seeing same issue, ok, one sec, let me figure out where the file is
ok in termial put locate 20-libgphoto2.fdi
ok, gksu gedit /usr/share/hal/fdi/preprobe/10osvendor/20-libgphoto2.fdi
ctl-f and find Sansa E200
found it
delete the blovk
ok
ok, now you can save and close the file, and restart your comp (the easy way) or run /ect/init.d/hal restart and replug your sansa
i saved the file, restarted hal, and reconnected, still not mounting
do i need to restart X for some reason?
no, it wasn't hal, sorry...
just reboot, i cant remember the command to restart gphoto's detection service right at the moment
ok, rebooting
it somehow thinks it's part HAL...
i removed /usr/share/hal/fdi/preprobe/10osvendor/20-libgphoto2.fdi and it works now
thank you for your help :)
ok, just dont expect some cameras to work now :)
i don't even own a camera ;)
i have one of the Kodak Easyshare crap cams
